page.title: 19 THE CASTLE INN.
page.content: The Castle Inn is 180 to 200 years old. Before it became a pub it was three cottages and then built into a hotel and in 1896 it was built into a Pub. The opening hours are 10.00 a.m. to 2.30 p.m. and 6.00 to 11.00 p.m. The most popular drink is bitter, the most popular food in the pub is ham, egg and chips. As a hotel it has got two rooms. The publican, Mr. Wormley, has been here for 11 years. The clubs which are held here are Saltwood Cricket Club, Tennis Club, Bowls Club and some meetings. The pub is open every day of the week.
